message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest Generalized Anxiety Disorder, and among the options, Paroxetine is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat anxiety disorders as a first-line treatment. Propranolol is a beta-blocker used to treat symptoms of anxiety, but not necessarily the underlying anxiety disorder. Alprazolam is a benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety but has a higher risk for dependence and withdrawal. Lurasidone is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat bipolar disorder and schizophrenia, not anxiety disorders.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest generalized anxiety disorder. Paroxetine, a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor, is a first-line treatment for generalized anxiety disorder. Propranolol is a beta-blocker that may help with physical symptoms of anxiety but is not a first-line treatment for generalized anxiety disorder. Alprazolam is a benzodiazepine that is reserved for short-term use in acute anxiety situations. Lurasidone is an antipsychotic medication that is not indicated for anxiety.

Propranolol is a beta blocker that can help reduce physical symptoms of anxiety, but it is not first-line treatment for anxiety disorders. Alprazolam is a benzodiazepine that can help with acute anxiety symptoms, but it is not first-line for long-term treatment due to risk of dependence. Lurasidone is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar depression and schizophrenia, not anxiety disorders.

Lurasidone is an antipsychotic medication used for bipolar disorder and schizophrenia, not for GAD.
